completion_summary:
Research completed covering 7 threat intelligence sources from the past 30 days. Identified 3 significant threat patterns relevant to the security posture review:

1. Increased phishing campaigns targeting cloud infrastructure credentials
2. New ransomware variants exploiting unpatched VPN appliances
3. Supply chain compromise attempts via compromised npm packages

No anomalies detected beyond baseline expectations. All sources verified and dated within the required 30-day window.

deliverables.name: threat-intel-summary.md
deliverables.notes: Main deliverable - covers all required sections

deliverables.name: source-list.csv
deliverables.notes: Optional deliverable - structured list of all sources reviewed with dates and URLs

acceptance_test_results.test: Summary covers at least 5 distinct sources
Each source dated within the last 30 days

acceptance_test_results.notes: Categorized into: Phishing, Ransomware, Supply Chain, Other
Each threat pattern includes relevance score (High/Medium/Low) with explanation

acceptance_test_results.test: No personal data or internal references included

notes:
The approved source list was excellent - made the research very straightforward. We found one source (example-feed.com) was temporarily down on Day 1, but it came back online and we were able to include it.

Suggestion for future similar requests: including 1-2 example outputs from previous research rounds would help calibrate the depth and format expectations.

feedback.suggestions: Consider providing example outputs from similar past research to help calibrate expectations. The template was helpful but real examples would be even better.
